page.title: 14ELECTIONS
page.content: On Thursday, 2nd May, 1985, people in County Durham went to the polling stations to vote in the elections for new County Councillors to serve for the next four years. Our area, the Evenwood Ward, includes Cockfield, Etherley, Toft Hill, Evenwood, Butterknowle, Woodland, Copley and Hamsterley. This is a mostly country area with scattered settlements and farms, in which, except for opencast working, coal mining has almost disappeared and there is a high rate of unemployment. Three candidates stood for election:- Mr J Armstrong was an Independent who had been on the County and District Councils for many years; Mr J Priestley was a local Labour Party candidate; Mr K Walton was an Independent already serving on the Teesdale District Council. They all
